text: I should have gotten the cheese pizza period!  Veggie pizza was downright awful.  Nothing good was happening with it.  I am plantbased and do know good veggie pizza when I eat it.  This was a huge disappointment.  Way to much was on the crust for it to hold all the items thus making the crust Soggy with a capital S!
Mom and Pop restaurant in the C concourse of Philly's airport. Diamond in the rough - great service and huge portions! Great choice for a quick breakfast!
Better than it looks, but still just "perfectly alright".  Don't get too excited. They are doing a good job, but the job is providing pretty basic stuff.

My favorite place when in the Philly / NJ area. Abraham makes you feel like family! The food is immaculate with specials to delight the most posh palette. The calamari salad to start is my favorite way to go. Even during covid the experience has been great. Don't try and go without a RSVP!

Best pizza in the airport. Great counter staff, great pizza chefs, super friendly manager and owner. Wide variety of fresh pizza and sliced. They give 30% off for all airport employees, which is pretty great. At the end of the night they give the leftover pizza to the airport police and TSA officers who work the night shift.

Talk about the most delicious Pizza you will find (not just at an airport but in general) with the sweetest people. I get to the airport early to get pizza here out of my way. Everything is so fresh and delicious.

I more or less stumbled upon Aldo Lamberti Trattoria in Philadelphia's international airport after a flight. During COVID-19 quite a few options are closed so I decided to get some food where I could before my next flight. I'm sure glad I did.

I was skeptical at the food at first, as it's airport food, however don't let that keep you away. The food is delicious and of really good quality. I have gotten some slices of pizza here, both cheese and veggie which were very good. I also have had a eggplant parm stack that was absolutely delicious. The eggplant is spot on. 

The line moves quickly and the people are nice. They have a sanitizing station as well as some condiments towards the end of the line. I absolutely will not hesitate to come here again.

Didn't expect it but, Aldo Lamberti Trattoria was actually extremely good. Cool vibe. Such a wonderful menu, it was simply hard to choose, but I am really happy that I got Chicken Teriyaki. The service was outstanding. They were fast, effective, and got everything right. I can genuinely say Aldo Lamberti Trattoria is amazing.

Located in Philadelphia's C Terminal across from Gate C24 this place is hands down the best Trattoria food I've ever had! Large portions, spot on flavor, crust made on the spot and fresh ingredients makes me want to travel here just for the food here!! Hot, fresh and fast! Don't waste time on any place else! These guys are professional, friendly and want to have u as a customer!
Amazing food amazing people staff and amazing food again . Love it. Everything from breakfast to dinner.. love the veg choices and morning bagels
We went here for our date night and loved it. Feels like a special night out and the seafood is the best.  Chris Vtrainers Personal Training Studios

This was the best airport food I have ever had and and it was quite possibly the best breakfast sandwich I've ever tasted!  Large fresh baked chibatta style bread soft on the inside and chewy on the outside with fresh cooked eggs and bacon!  The entire sandwich (which could easily feed two) was toasted until the bread was hot and crispy and the cheese was melty and golden. 
I'm not saying it would be worth booking a flight to get one... but I wouldn't be shocked if you told me that you did. 


Godetevi questo tesoro!

The best pizza ever seriously! Light fluffy but  delicious  dough under cheesy extravaganza of flavor! Bursting with goodness, I could have eaten more and taken a whole pie with me! If I could! Now I want to fly here again just for this pizza!!!

Adjusted for 5* given this pizza place is in an airport.  I'd choose this option over Sbarro's any day.  Does this mean the pizza and compete against the best outside in the airport? No, but it'll be one of your best airport pizza options.  I don't have much to rave about this place, but if  you cannot stand bad options at airport, this will be a good alternative to the not-so-greatly rated "philly cheesesteaks" options in the airport.

Airport food is so horrendous I make an active effort to eat at the best places possible with the limited options I have.  This place won't disappoint.

Either this pizza is really good or the pizza where I live is really awful. Highly recommend stopping here for a slice! It was the best pizza I've had in a long time and I didn't have to wait long at all.

Used to be good. Food was cold (eggs) and I didn't even get my bagel they completely forgot about me yet when she handed my bag of food she said BAGEL IS IN THERE WITH EGGS. So disappointed I guess the employees don't really care.

Best airport pizza I have ever had. The crust was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The toppings tasted fresh, and the service was polite and very friendly.  The employees all seemed to be enjoying themselves.
Fast casual pizza place with a large selection of gourmet pies. Has a few non-pizza items also.  One of the better restaurants in the terminal and worth a try.

Waaawaaweewa. Quick Breakfast in the airport is sometimes hard to find but with 6 mins to boarding this place hit the spoooot. HUGE panini sandwich and pizza that could be shared with two people!! Great prices honestly for the size of the food. Conveniently located in C terminal in the middle of all the gates. Worth a try if your in the philly airport! I heard lunch is good too

An unexpected gem. You don't expect to find some of the best pizza you'll ever have in an airport, but this is your lucky day. We had: 1) sausage, pepper, & onion; 2) vegetable (fresh eggplant, zucchini, ricotta, and basil; and 3) chicken and onion. Excellent thin crust and serious sauce. Although the slices seem expensive ($6 each), they actually are double slices, so one feeds your average appetite. Look for it in C terminal near C23.
Gorgeous pizzas. Mushroom slice very tasty. Some of the slices may be five star worthy but I didn't get to taste everything.

Absolutely delicious!! I'm visiting from San Francisco, first time in Philly! I Love pizza and happened to walk by this place around gate C 24 at the airport! I'm amazed by how many different choices they have and ready to go! Very cheesy and absolutely tasty! I wish I had taken a photo of my super delicious sliced pizza before finishing it in seconds! A slice is big but it's so good that I might get another one before hopping on the plane! Love Philly!

One of the best places for airport food that I have experienced.  The food is excellent. It is one of the few places with breakfast at the airport. All panini bread for sandwiches is home made. Breakfast meals are excellent and large enough to share.  At the Philadelphia Airport, it is located right across from gate C24 in concourse C. 

I would have rated it a five star, but the employees were arguing with each other while preparing my sandwich. That was very unprofessional. They ended up putting cheese on my sandwich when I asked for no cheese. There is a seating area, but small. They also accept euro for those returning from a trip from Europe. 

We will be sure to return here when passing through the Philadelphia Airport in the future.

Very efficient service; pizza is made daily on site and reheated at a moment's notice. It's not typical airport pizza and taste delicious. The margherita was greaseless, a thin mozzarella layer of cheese on the bottom, topped with mild tomato sauce and some some basil. Very fair for a generous slice at $4.50. 

It's worth going out of the way and even if you're in a rush, I watched them for 20 minutes as I ate, every order was fulfilled within 5 minutes of ordering. don't expect perfection, but this is so close to 5 stars.
Very tasty and friendly of abrupt fast food. Excellent pizza if hard to eat without a fork!

Terminal C.  This has to be the biggest breakfast in the airport for the money.  Scrambled egg platter with bacon is $10 and enough for two people.  Food is average in taste, but very generous which is why I added a star.
The manager was so accommodating to our dietary restrictions. The food was hot and delicious. The bacon was thick! The portion size was great for the cost! Much appreciated!

It's a slice of pizza.  It's better than sbarro, but so is an old shoe.  

Not sure why everyone is freaking out about it.  

Perhaps all the food options in PHL airport really suck.  

Had a slice of sausage, onion and pepper.  It was ok.  Crust was ok, toppings were ok, service was pleasant and it was quick.

Amazing pizza & wings!! I had the bell pepper, sausage and onion slice of pizza and from the cheese to the crust it was fantastic! The baked  wings are beyond delicious! Bonus the men at the counter are so delightful and pleasant. The place to eat at Philadelphia International Airport.
I got a chicken pest sandwitch here before a flight once and it was much better than I expected. Will try again if I'm in the terminal.

After a very disappointing flight cancellation on Sunday, I needed a quick bite to eat as I made plans for a hotel and new flight. This restaurant had delicious pizza and the sauce was incredible. I had a slice of sausage Margherita. Staff had a good sense of humor and service was quick.

In Terminal C at Philly airport, you could have another $10+ cheesesteak on your layover or a fresh, crisp salad with fresh roasted chicken for $10 from this family owned gem. Airport food is the worst but everything we tried here was surprisingly great. Cheese pizza was so yum I stole bites from my 2 year old. The cannoli was delish hours later on my flight with a cup of airline coffee. I prefer custard cannolis because I'm a snob and used to live in the North End neighborhood of Boston with access to amazing Italian food, but this was not bad at all.  I don't fly through Philly much, but if you do, this place is a big 2 thumbs up!!

This is going to be short ... absolutely the best food of any kind in an airport. However, this would warrant 5 stars in New York, New Haven or Naples. 

Their pizza is beyond excellent and the fact that it is in an airport just makes this place even more unexpected. 

Seriously, while everything here is great ... the sausage margherita pizza is literally one of the best pies I have ever had. 

Rearrange your itinerary and fly through Philly for this place.
I wish they had a restaurant in CT! Best pizza and the cannoli is the best I ever had! Wish I flew through Philadelphia more often

Do not go here. The service was awful and the employees were so rude. The employees did not care about their customers as they were too busy boasting about their restaurant and trashing every other restaurant in the airport! My sandwhich was extremely soggy and there was a hair in it! I will never eat here again! DO NOT RECOMMEND!!!

The pizza was absolutely fantastic. Warmed just enough. Had the four cheese and the margherita sausage. The cashier was so so polite even memorizing each customer's name. And the cannolli were equally delicious. Great spot for airport food.

I found this place on Yelp and decided to try it, was so glad I did - it was definitely the best pizza I've had in an airport.  And it seemed relatively healthy!  I tried a slice of the margarita with sausage.  The slice size was decent, but it was so good that I wish I had gotten two slices.  A little pricy, but it was good!

Definitely the best pizza I've had in an airport, and definitely in the running for best pizza I've had. Quick friendly service. Only downside is a small seating area that is shared with another restaurant.

LOCALLY MADE pizza!!!  Phenomenal crust.  I had the sausage margarita pizza.  AMAZING.  Very friendly and nice staff - all locals and a ton of Philadelphia "brotherly" charm.   Cannot recommend highly enough.
Very yummy pizza for about five bucks for each large slice. Service was also extraordinarly nice. Can't go wrong.

I don't expect flavor at the airport but the mushroom pizza I had was great. A cracker thin crust that snapped as I took my first bite was a pleasant surprise. The sauce is solidly tomato while also imparting subtleties of garlic and oregano in a well balanced flavor. 
Mushrooms were fresh and yet not watery. They finish with a chiffonade of basil that was fresh even in late October.  
The counter service is friendly but keeps things moving. Def stop by.

The guy working the cashier (seems like he may be the manager) was unbelievably pleasant. Very attentive to his customers - I'm gluten free. He was patient with me and my requests and helped customize my order. I got a veggie omelette with melted cheese and roasted potatoes. Delish! I took a double take to remind myself I was in an airport and not at a gourmet breakfast cafe. I paid $13 (included my bottle of water) Try this place. You won't be disappointed.
Friendly service, solid food. I had a great panini & Caesar. Would happily come back next time I'm in the terminal.
That was an AMAZING veggie pizza.  I mean, that thing was good. I'm looking up other locations in other cities. So damn good.

Really friendly people helping at both the pizza station as well as the panini and cold food section. 
Ordered a capresi panini - warmer up with a bit of balsamic glaze. Perfect food to take on the plane with you!! My friend ordered the salami panini - she said nice touch with the fresh bread!
Who would have thought that the best pizza would be in the airport? Pepperoni and sausage slice was so good!
Cute, friendly guys behind counter. Awesome pizza. Probably the best slice of buffalo chicken pizza I've come across in my life.

If you have to walk several terminals do it to get this pizza!  Just had the "white" cheese pizza. Would like to come back tomorrow for a panini - or have them open one if these in my Houston neighborhood!

Simply one of the worst airport restaurants I've  ever tried in my life. We had a panini, chicken caesar salad and a slice of pizza. The salad was simply disgusting and inedible, the pizza mediocre and the sandwich was boring. We threw most of it in the trash. It was ridiculously expensive to make matters worse. Would not eat there again if it was free. Try Caffe Famiglia if you are interested in decent Italian food at PHL. We ate there afterwards and it was pretty good.
On the run to Puerto Rico and stopped by here to grab a quick bite. Their breakfast pizza was AWESOME!
